content: @Thomas Beale I'm going to follow Erik's lead and move this to the openehr stream.

CapabilityStatement can be used to define requirements for implementation, theoretical implementation capabilities (e.g. shrink-wrapped software that will be configured on installation) and 'actual' capabilities - what a given server at a given IP address was capable of at of 12:53pm today

If neither CapabilityStatement.software or CapabilityStatement.implementation are present, you're looking at a "what should be done" resource - the kind that's appropriate to include in an IG or an RFP.
Error with: "Add dateTime property to Observation.effectiveDateTime" does not allow me to SAVE my date/time. Only way to get out of the pop-up box is to hit Cancel.
Mark: you also need to click to select a date as well. Will fix to default to today...
btw - time does not seem to be correct anyway - probably a time zone thing - will look into that as well, but at least you can enter data now!
Yep, can enter a date and save, but not a date and time. We're getting there!
Actually, I think date and time works (it's just time alone that fails) - but the time is weird...
